decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.

<p>Pre-commencement site meeting: Prior to any development works, a site meeting of the following shall take place:&nbsp;client;&nbsp;site manager / foreman; appointed arboricultural consultant;&nbsp;LPA tree officer.</p>

<ul style="margin-top: 0cm;">
 </ul><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">Site supervision: Prior to commencement of
     development, details of all tree protection monitoring and site
     supervision by suitably qualified specialist (ideally the appointed
     consultant) shall be submitted for approval. The development thereafter
     will be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details.</p><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">A tree protection monitoring
regime should be adopted onsite (or agreed to in pre-commencement meeting) and
the site personnel induction form (appendix MS iii, ArbolEuro report) should be
used by relevant personnel being inducted or assigned monitoring duties.
Inspections / supervision will be required for the following:</p><ul style="margin-top: 0cm;">
 
 
 </ul><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">Inspection of installed
     tree protection barriers â€“ staked and braced tree protection barriers as
     detailed in tree protection plans (Appendix 4, ArbolEuro report)<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">Installation of
     temporary tree protection box around T1 Scots pine, as detailed in AMS and
     prior to commencement of works<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">Supervision:
     Installation of temporary anti-compaction ground protection (Durabase or
     Eve-Trackway) within RPA of T1 Scots pine and prior to any mini-pile
     installation.</p><p style="margin-left: 0cm;">Supervision:
Exploratory excavation in proposed pile locations with hand tools or air
spading, to determine pile locations</p><p>







</p><p style="margin-left: 35.7pt;"><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">Site supervision (completion): The completed schedule of
supervision and monitoring shall be submitted within 28 days of completion of
development (can be emailed to <a href="mailto:rebecca.farrar@harrow.gov.uk">rebecca.farrar@harrow.gov.uk</a>).
This condition may only be discharged on completion of development, subject to
satisfactory evidence of compliance with the approved tree protection measures
through pre-agreed schedule of monitoring.<o:p></o:p></p>
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">Arboricultural Impact Assessment;&nbsp;Fire Strategy Statement; Heritage Statement; Tree Protection Plan; Tree Constraints Plan; 24007 HH1 01, 01;&nbsp;</span>24007 HH1 01.02 Rev C;&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">24007 HH1 01/03.</span>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
description: Single storey side extension; conversion of garage into art studio ancillary to dwelling; single storey rear extension; front porch; external alterations (part retrospective).
